head.supplied: Memorandum ¶ ¶ In accordance with the Undersecretary's minute of the 24 & 28 Jan. 1889 ¶ the fascicles of the "Educational collections of Austral. plants" have been fetched from the Gov. Offices, ¶ ...

div.p: M89/916, unit 401, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In accordance with the Undersecretary's minute of the 24 & 28 Jan. 1889
See notes to M to T. Wilson, 19 January 1889. the fascicles of the "Educational collections of Austral. plants" have been fetched from the Gov. Offices,

1 set II. From these I & II have been supplied to Dr Kirtikar, and I & II also to Prof Sereno Watson of Boston and I & II likewise for Prof Luerssen of Koenigsberg, the Department being much indebted to him for a very large sending of dried plants. The rest will be kept in the bot. Museum at disposal, and only be distributed on special order from the office of the hon. the Chief Secretary.
